repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Use separate feature guards for:
1) using a global module state struct ("CYTHON_USE_MODULE_STATE")
2) using PyType_FromSpec() for extension types ("CYTHON_USE_TYPE_SPECS")
3) actual limited-API special casing ("CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API")

commit.message:
Split the current "CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API" macro guard into separate feature guards:
1) using a global module state struct ("CYTHON_USE_MODULE_STATE")
2) using PyType_FromSpec() for extension types ("CYTHON_USE_TYPE_FROM_SPEC")
3) actual limited-API special casing ("CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API")
Mark the Limited-API and module state struct features as experimental.
Add travis test setups for using PyType_FromSpec() for creating extension types.
Avoid overly complicated code in __Pyx_FetchCommonTypeFromSpec() when we are not compiling against the Limited-API.

Correctly set up the bases tuple for PyType_FromSpecWithBases() and stop relying on the PyTypeObject struct being available in several places by using the type pointer instead (and setting it early enough).
Rename "CYTHON_USE_TYPE_FROM_SPEC" feature flag to "CYTHON_USE_TYPE_SPECS".
Set the "tp_dealloc" slot from the type spec.

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Split the current "CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API" macro guard
